Sentencas: The formation of a low Cr-volatility and electrically conductive oxide outer layer atop an inner chromia layer via thermal oxidation is highly desirable for preventing chromium evaporation from solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) metallic interconnects at the SOFC operation temperatures.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: In this paper, a number of ferritic Fe-22Cr alloys with different levels of Mn and Ti as well as a Ni-based alloy Haynes 242 were cyclically oxidized in air at 800 degrees C for twenty 100-h cycles.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: No oxide scale spallation was observed during thermal cycling for any of these alloys.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: A mixed Mn2O3/TiO2 surface layer and/or a (Mn, Cr)(3)O-4 spinel outer layer atop a Cr2O3 inner layer was formed for the Fe-22Cr series alloys, while an NiO outer layer with a Cr2O3 inner layer was developed for Haynes 242 after cyclic oxidation.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: For the Fe-22Cr series alloys, the effects of Mn and Ti contents as well as alloy purity on the oxidation resistance and scale area specific resistance were evaluated.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: The performance of the ferritic alloys was compared with that of Haynes 242.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application

Sentencas: The mismatch in thermal expansion coefficient between the different layers in the oxide scale was identified as a potential concern for these otherwise promising alloys.
Titulo: Promising alloys for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect application
